summary: This is an email from an Assistant State Attorney (ASA) in Palm Beach County regarding the negotiated settlement in the Epstein case. It confirms the settlement is proceeding but notes a scheduling change: the judge wants the plea and sentencing to occur concurrently, not separately, and the case is set for the first week of January 2008, with the plea and sentence to occur before January 4, 2008.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case and negotiated settlement in Palm Beach County.

events.title: Email sent regarding Epstein settlement
events.description: An email was sent by the ASA to discuss the status of the Epstein settlement agreement.

events.title: Scheduled plea and sentencing
events.description: The case was set for the first week of January 2008, with the plea and sentence to occur concurrently before January 4, 2008, as ordered by the judge.

keyFacts: A negotiated settlement in the Epstein case in Palm Beach County was confirmed as a 'definite go' as of October 2007.
The judge in the case required the plea and sentencing to occur concurrently, not as separate events.
The case was scheduled for the first week of January 2008, with the plea and sentence to occur before January 4, 2008.
The communication indicates coordination between the Assistant State Attorney and other parties regarding the settlement agreement's timing.
